snippet: At age 29 and with two N.B.A. titles, James announced on Friday that he would return to Cleveland, where he played from 2003 to 2010.
abstract: LeBron James announces that he will return to Cleveland Cavaliers, where he played from 2003 to 2010, ending free agency in which he was pursued by a smorgasbord of basketball teams; James was vilified in Cleveland after his departure four years earlier, but he is likely to receive grateful forgiveness from fans as he seeks to deliver them a long-belated championship.
lead_paragraph: At age 29 and with two N.B.A. titles, James announced on Friday that he would return to Cleveland, where he played from 2003 to 2010.

headline.seo: LeBron James to Return to Cavaliers, Leaving Miami Heat
headline.main: The Decision Is Reversed, and Cleveland Is in a Forgiving Mood
headline.print_headline: The Decision Is Reversed, and Cleveland Is in a Forgiving Mood
